title: Matt Taylor (rugby union)
text:
Matt Taylor (born 16 September 1972 in <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>) is an Australian-born <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> coach and is the assistant coach (defence) of the Australian National Rugby union team. He was formerly the assistant coach of the Scotland National Rugby Union team, <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> and the Queensland Reds.
Rugby Union career.
Playing career.
He holds a British passport as his parents are from <a href="Dunfermline">Dunfermline</a>, <a href="Fife">Fife</a>. He played in the <a href="Flanker%20%28rugby%20union%29">Flanker</a> position.
As a rugby player he played for various Scottish sides; <a href="Aberdeen%20GSFP%20RFC">Aberdeen GSFP</a>, <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> and <a href="Border%20Reivers%20%28rugby%29">Border Reivers</a>.
He also played for <a href="Exeter%20Chiefs">Exeter Chiefs</a>.
He was capped for <a href="Scotland%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland 'A'</a> thus confirming his Scottish nationality under World Rugby regulations.
Coaching career.
He was previously a defence coach of <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland Reds</a>. As a defence coach he has led <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland Reds</a> to the <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> title in 2011.
He joined <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in August 2012. As a defence coach he has led <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> to the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a> title in 2015.
Matt Taylor's contracts as assistant coach of Scotland and assistant coach of Glasgow Warriors were due to expire at end of the 2015 World Cup. 
Taylor left <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> to follow <a href="Gregor%20Townsend">Gregor Townsend</a> in taking over the <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland national rugby union team</a> in May 2017. He remained there until 2019. 
In 2019 he was chosen by current <a href="Australian%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wallabies</a> head coach <a href="Dave%20Rennie">Dave Rennie</a> as defence coach. He is currently based in <a href="Australia">Australia</a>.
